entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs first major solar plant comes online: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs first major solar plant comes online: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Masrik-1, Armenia‚Äôs first major solar power plant, came online, as the country continues to see a rapid growth in renewable energy generation. That helps put Armenia, which has set a 50% renewable energy target by 2030, well ahead of schedule. üìç Russia‚Äôs ambassador to Armenia reiterated Moscow‚Äôs willingness to sell Yerevan a new nuclear plant. Armenia, which has to shutter its current plant in the next decade, is also considering options from the United States. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Economy Ministry put forward a new bill to replace the country‚Äôs main investment law, saying the changes are needed to create a more attractive business climate. Read more: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/949868/

entry.title: Pashinyan, Aliyev hold rare meeting in Albania

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan, Aliyev hold rare meeting in Albania
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan had brief encounters with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan on the sidelines of a summit in Albania. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Interior Ministry fails to provide answers as to why the search for an accused Azerbaijani war criminal has been called off, citing law on classified information. üìç Sergey Kopyrkin, Russia's ambassador to Armenia, condemned an Armenian ex-military official for suggesting a German victory in World War II could have been beneficial. üìç Insights: Why Netanyahu‚Äôs Baku visit was scrapped- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m5VGX-OSr6k
